name: Test frequency - Prior to personnel starting
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all crew members are briefed on the CWP
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Signed off CWP
Conformance Criteria - Ensure all drawings are approved and of the latest revision, or written approval from PAB
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - IFC drawings or written approval from PAB
Test frequency - Once prior to works commencing
Conformance Criteria - TRC review and approval
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Approved SCWMP
1.04 - Method Statements - At least 5 days before commencing any supply of concrete to site a method statement(s) shall be submitted to the the Design Engineer for review.
Specifications and Standards - Concrete specification Clause 8.2
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - CPSA
1.05 - Concrete thermal modelling - large colume pours to consider thermal effects
Specifications and Standards - Concrete specification Clause 9.2 and Special Concrete NZS 3104
Conformance Criteria - Maximum concrete shall not exceed 70 degree C and maximum differential 20 degree C
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Heat of Hydration Report

2.01 - Material Compliance - Concrete - Concrete mix designs include 30MPa, 40MPa & 50MPa with aggregate sizes ranging from 13mm for SCC to 19mm are to be submitted to the CPS team for review and approval for use with the work covered in this ITP incliding additives required specific to the special contrcrete for heat of hydration.
Specifications and Standards - CPS Approval, Concrete Specifications Clause 7.2 and 9.2
Conformance Criteria - CPS Approval, Concrete Specifications Clause 7.2 and 9.1
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Request for approval of concrete mix

2.02 - Material Compliance - Reinforcing - Steel Reinforcement shall be Grade 500E and comply with AS/NZS 4671 & NZS 3109 and shall be the grade called up on the design drawing and approved shop drawings.
Specifications and Standards - AS/NZS4671 & NZS3109, Reinforcing Specifications Clause 6.1
Method/Description - Document review, Mill certificates provided
Conformance Criteria - CPS Approval, AS/NZS4671 & NZS3109, Reinforcing Specifications Clause 6.1
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Traceability of steel via Cast Batch/Heat Summary and Detail Sheets and Mill Certificates

2.03 - Material Compliance - Mechanical Anchorage System - Mechanical Anchorage system used with grade 300E and 500E complying with AS/NZ 4671. Systems to be considered: Ancon RT, IMBMS, Reidbar Steel
Specifications and Standards - Systems tested to demonstrate compliance with section 4.2.1.f of the Bridge Manual.
○ Mechanical Coupling system to be tested to demonstrate compliance with AS/NZS4671
Conformance Criteria - CPS Approval, Reinforcing Specifications Clause 6.1.5
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Request for approval from CPS and manufactureres certificates

3.1.1 - Pre-Pour Concrete Inspection - Reinforcing, formwork & cast in itmes to be regularly inspected by nominated Quality Representative and or Design Representative. Full pre-pour inspection to be carried out prior to pour date.
Specifications and Standards - Concrete Specification Clause 5, 7 & 8.5 - 8.7
Test frequency - Prior to concrete pour
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Signed pre-pour inspection sheet

3.1.2 - Concrete Testing and Monitoring - Onsite testing of each truck for workability. A set of 4 test cylinders per 50m3 or part thereof for 1 cylinder tested at 7 days and the remaining 3 cylinders tested at 28 days for compressive strength.
Specifications and Standards - Concrete Specification Clause 7.2.1 & 7.2.2
Method/Description - Test results and pour record sheet
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Concrete Delivery dockets with onsite test records, Concrete Compressive Strength test results
3.1.3 - Concrete Placing - Concrete shall be handled, placed, finished and cured in accordance with concrete specification.
Specifications and Standards - NZS 3109 section 7 and Concrete Specification Clause 8.3
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Site photos
3.1.4 - Special Concrete - Slabs on Grade. Plant engineer to design concrete to eliminate the incidence of plastic shrinkage cracking, plastic settlement and or early age thermal cracking
Specifications and Standards - Concrete specification Clause 9.1 and Special Concrete NZS 3104
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Data results

3.1.5 - Special Concrete - Mass Concrete Pours. Temperature monitoring using data loggers as per manuacturers reconmendations. Following first mass pour, data results to confirm if further monitoring required at second mass pour.
Specifications and Standards - Concrete specification Clause 9.2 and Special Concrete NZS 3104
Conformance Criteria - Maximum concrete shall not exceed 70 degree C and maximum differential 20 degree C
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Data results

4.01 - Post pour inspection - Inspection of any Type B Construction Joints if applicable with respective concrete pour. Quality Representative and or Design Representative to inspect concrete surfaces after the formwork have been stripped. 7 days curing required on top and sides of the column. If formwork are not removed before 7 days, they act as curing method. Formworks removed within the 7-day period after the pour requires spaying of curing membrane as per Work Instruction.
Specifications and Standards - NZS 3109 section 7 and Concrete Specification Clause 8.4 and 8.10
Test frequency - After each concrete pour
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - Signed post pour inspection sheet
4.02 - As-built - Final survey as-built and red lines to be completed at the column construction completion.
Specifications and Standards - Concrete Specification Clause 7.8
Test frequency - At the completion of the Sub-Lot of work
4.03 - Final Handover Package - Collation of all QA, as-built drawings, testing and monitoring documentation
Specifications and Standards - Concrete Specification Clause 5.3
Verifying Records Checklists, Test and Supplier Certificates - As-built drawings, testing results, monitoring documentation, operation and maintenance report, Producer Statements
